<<<<<<< HEAD
Inquisitio Anglicana: or The disguise discovered. Shevving the proceedings of the commissioners at White hall, for the approbation of ministers, in the examinations of Anthony Sadler Cler: (chaplain to the Right Honourable the Lady Pagett, dowager) vvhose delay, triall, suspence and vvrong, presents it self for remedy, to the Ld Protector, and the High Court of Parliament: and for information to the clergy, and all the people of the nation. Sadler, Anthony, b. 1610.
[6], 17, [1] p.
Printed by J. Grismond, for Richard Royston at the Angel in Ivie-lane, London, : 1654.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Octob: 23. A variant has: a comma after "or", a period after "Ld" and a period after "Parliament" in lines 2, 12 and 13, respectively, of the title page. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
Inquisitio Anglicana: or The disguise discovered. Shevving the proceedings of the commissioners at White hall, for the approbation of ministers, in the examinations of Anthony Sadler Cler: (chaplain to the Right Honourable the Lady Pagett, dowager) vvhose delay, triall, suspence and vvrong, presents it self for remedy, to the Ld Protector, and the High Court of Parliament: and for information to the clergy, and all the people of the nation. Sadler, Anthony, b. 1610.
[6], 17, [1] p.
Printed by J. Grismond, for Richard Royston at the Angel in Ivie-lane, London, : 1654.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Octob: 23. A variant has: a comma after "or", a period after "Ld" and a period after "Parliament" in lines 2, 12 and 13, respectively, of the title page. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Richard Royston
J. Grismond
the Angel in Ivie-lane
